intro: Racosperma lysiphloium, commonly known as the small-flowered acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has small, rounded seed pods that contain numerous seeds. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Racosperma lysiphloium plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various native wildlife species.
